content: Do I understand it correct that snomed also has a zulip? The DNS doesnot exist :-( I do have a practical question about snomed, not FHIR related.

SNOMED Int. doesn't have Zulip. But it does have SNOCHAT, and the snomed-fhir SNOCHAT channel is cross-posted to the FHIR Zulip snomed stream snomed-fhir topic (hopefully that makes sense!).
https://chat.snomedtools.org/home
Hmm. It says it knows me, but then is says "User not active"?? Who can I contact?
The new channel is now https://snomedintl.slack.com/. @Grahame Grieve do you want me to put a bridge? Though now it requires a '@ihtsdo.org' account.

We need to let people know about the SNOMED channel here, which you've just done. As far as the bridge goes, it's been a bit clumsy and I don't know that it has been particularly helpful, and the volume recently has pretty much dropped to zero, so I'm thinking that it's probably not going to be worth the effort to create it and keep it maintained with the new channel. That's my take on it at the moment. @Peter Williams @Michael Lawley @Peter Jordan Thoughts from others?
The bridge will become stable with Slack this time around, in the past it was because Rocketchat API being flaky.
I think it's a good idea in principle
I agree that it is good in principle, so I'm certainly fine with trying it again with the new bridge to Slack.
@Rob Hausam I'm good with that too.
OK, though the workspace has a registration moat which requires a @ihtsdo.org address though. One method is to have me access on a bot token (https://api.slack.com/bot-users).
@Rory Davidson can you help with the access on ihtsdo side?
@Grahame Grieve of course, not a problem. Just say what you need and we'll get it set up.
well, whatever @Rein Zustand is asking for
sorry, I'd missed that message. Not used to using Zulip.. getting the necessary token now
